p: Nanoparticles have been demonstrated to generate more free radicals and ROS than larger particles, likely due to their higher surface area [ 12]. NiO NPs have been reported to reduce cell viability and to induce oxidative stress by depletion of glutathione and induction of reactive oxygen species in HEp-2 and MCF-7 cells [ 45], cell death via apoptotic pathway and ROS generation in HepG2 cells in dose-dependent manner [ 32], NiO NPs also increased intracellular ROS, apoptosis and necrosis in BEAS-2B and A549 cells [ 10], Our results confirmed that NiO NPs is toxic to A549 cells.
